Description: Bronze finger-ring; stirrup-shaped of Egyptian or Egyptianising style; oval bezel and part of hoop only; engraved with the name of Isis, seated figure of Maat and seated figure of a child.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (1216)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 313)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 34)
Catling 1964 / Cypriot Bronzework in the Mycenaean World (234, No. 1)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P44, Pl XI)
